ratings.comment: Very dense, slides had lots of words. He would get off track a lot. Sometimes hard to tell what was necessary to know or not, especially when studying for exams. Plus, exams seemed unnecessary considering the sizable project we worked on throughout the course.

I didn't directly interact with him because a lot of the work for the class is done during discussion, but he's a pretty friendly guy from what I've seen in lecture. Pretty knowledgeable about the content, though the lectures can get long and kind of boring. There are 2 exams (50pt multiple choice) and 1 semester-long group project.

The group project is awful if you get paired with the wrong people, but the course concepts are interesting if you're passionate about a career in strategic communications. The capstone campaign project is a great portfolio item. Dhavan is fine as a professor -- didn't interact with him much but he's knowledgeable and respected.

Professor Shah is an amazing professor that really knows how to engage with his students. The course was a semester long group project as well as 2 exams. He has so much experience that he wants to share with his students so he's a great resource to have. He is 100% willing to help and work with his students, he really wants them to succeed.

Professor Shah is easily one of the best professors I've had in college. Worked in the marketing/communications field before teaching and has great stories and advice about the industry. Lecture can be note heavy but he makes it really enjoyable, and was always available for questions. He was flexible with due dates for takehome exams.

Professor Shah is an outstanding researcher, but it is clear that his personal research takes priority over his students and the courses he teaches. Lectures were not related to assignments and multiple group papers. It felt like Shah and the TA were teaching two different courses. If you aren't into data, don't sign up for J566.

Professor Shah is a super nice guy and super helpful before/after class. Lecture slides are posted online, so attendence is not mandatory. The bulk of the grade is a big group project which takes a lot of outside class time/effort. The best presentations on the group project do not have to take the final exam. Easy A if you get a good group!

Shah is a great professor. He gives great feedback throughout the semester as you work on the group project and has a really big personality. Definitely made lecture enjoyable, which isn't an easy thing to do. Definitely my favorite professor in the J School so far.

Dhavan is hands down the best prof I've had. He worked for Leo Burnett on McD's, so he has great experience and loves sharing it. He gives excellent feedback, but be ready, because he's going to be honest with you. He tells some really great stories, too. If you have a chance to take a class with him, take it.
Dedicated prof.  Knows his stuff.  My favorite prof in the J-school so far.

Dhavan is legit the man. He is very knowledgeable about advertising, PR and media with a background in real world experience. He isn't cocky, but just a  really cool dude who happens to be a great teacher as well. Always willing to help out if you see him, canceled class so we could watch the Badger national championship game. One of the best here.
Best professor I have had thus far. HE IS AWESOME. Super interesting and his grading is very fair. Great teaching style, very understanding, and I had zero complaints.

Shah is a great professor and always keeps students interested in the material. He is funny and his lectures are anything but dry. He shares real-life experiences that make up a lot of lecture. Great professor and definitely learned a lot from this course

Dhavan is an excellent professor and a brilliant guy. Also, in response to the few females who have made comments about him being dismissive toward females, I think that is really untrue. I am a female and he has done nothing but help me in my career and I've seen him do the same for several other students both male and female.

Shah is a great guy who loves all areas of strategic communications. His background in advertising and public campaigns provides the framework for the course and gives you a taste of the real world. The tests are not bad, but the J345 project will consume your life. However, you will learn a lot from the project and enjoy it.
I LOVE DHAVAN.  MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR IN DEPARTMENT AND ONE OF MY FAVORITES IN THE UNIVERSITY.  LECTURES ARE REALLY ORGANIZED AND HE POSTS STUFF IN ADVANCE (USUALLY).  TESTS ARE FAIR.  HE IS AWESOME
Interactive lectures, modern examples in a time of aging professors, professional experience, structures class around a large group project (closest thing to professional experience)
Great Professor with a wonderful personality.  If you ask a question about advertising you know he is well versed in the category and is more than willing to answer questions.
Seminar on Internet and Politics.  Great class.  Highly recommended.
No Comments
Great Teacher.  Nice Guy
Dhavan is the best.  I LOVED this class.  Hot when he has a haircut :-*
Great class.  Professor really knows the materials and is very inspiring.  Helped me get a job after graduating.  Best professor I have had in the advertising program at the UW.
No Comments
Two weeks in and already the best class I have had dealing with advertising (of the three I have had).  Not too much reading, but the projects look like thy will be a lot of work.
Good Professor.  Not as funny as he thinks he is, but damm smart. Tests are fair but long.  Big final presentation in both.
No Comments
Better in professional classes than the theory ones.  Had him for J447 and J614 and liked J447 better.  J614 was kind of boring. Shah has a good lecturing style and gets the ideas acroiss.
he is never in his office during office hours. Dismissive, especially to female students.
No Comments
Best prof I had last semester. His professional experience and teaching style really add a lot to the material, which is interesting but kinda dry.  Class project was a lot of work.

I have had three classes with him and think he is one of the better profs at the UW.  His is smart and well organized, but tough.  He is willing to talk over projects and gives good feedback. He can be hard to reach and sometimes misses his office hours, but other than that, his is great.
One of the best professors I have had at the UW.

hated his classes. stupid and obviously never learned anything during his time at UW (well, everyone who is a UW alum is stupid, so there) and the journalism program is falling apart because of people like him.

I think it would be interesting to see the male/female ratio of these ratings because in my experience this professor was very discouraging and I have heard the same from several females in the J-school
pretentious and arrogant
Taking J447 with Shah right now.  He knows his stuff and makes sure you get it before testing you.  Gives time in class for wqork and answering questions.  Very approachabl;e.

Good class for basic research skills, but the team teaching thing doesn't work so well.  The professors don't seem to communicate as much as they should. Some repetition across them. Dhavan is an excellent teacher and very knowledgeable. Would rahter take class just with him.
Great prof. who takes the time to make sure you understand the ideas.  Very approachable and knowledgable.  Always encourages discussion and makes you apply what you learn
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
This dude rocks!  One smart ****er.

Dhavan makes this class a pleasure and at the same time packs it with good content. He always makes time to answer questions and meet with you if you need help.  He is also funny and has lots of insights about the professional wold.
Good class that could be better. Class project and presentatio was fun.  Content is interesting but difficult.
Dhavan is very nice and helpful.  He's tough, but in a good way.  J614 was a very difficult class with him, but he was great in J345.
